I once thought geothermal energy could never supply more than 5 percent of the global energy mix. Today, I believe it could provide up to 20 percent of the world’s electricity.
Fervo Energy
is one of a handful of companies helping to prove that geothermal can be viable almost anywhere.

Post_Content:
Diarrhea was once one of the top killers of children. Today, deaths from diarrhea have dropped by 72% thanks to affordable rotavirus vaccines, organizations like
Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance
, and improved sanitation. But with almost 350,000 children still dying each year, and new threats emerging, the fight is far from over:
https://lnkd.in/gDHJr9tN

Post_Content: U.S. health aid enables community health workers like Agnes Nambozo, a vaccinator in Uganda, to save lives. Cutting this funding puts millions of people around the world at risk.

Post_Author_JobTitle: Chair, Gates Foundation and Founder, Breakthrough EnergyChair, Gates Foundation and Founder, Breakthrough Energy
Post_Time: 2mo •2 months ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
Post_Content: I’ve been working in global health for 25 years—as long as I was CEO of Microsoft. At this point, I know as much about improving health in poor countries as I do about software. And I’m certain that just as U.S. health aid saves lives. And when that aid is cut—abruptly and without a plan—lives are lost.
